result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lamont R Briggs Jr

defendant.name: Briggs, Lamont R, Jr
defendant.address: 6972 N. Raintree Court, Unit B, Milwaukee, WI 53223

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lamont R Briggs Jr in court.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Pre-trial conference held. Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Michael Plaisted, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning at the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AMT

Defendant Lamont R Briggs Jr in court. Student Intern Kevin Clancy under the supervision of attorney Claire E Zyber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. 
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.
DEFENDANT DECLINES PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.
Case is adjourned for pretrial in Branch 29.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Lamont R Briggs Jr
Current: 6972 N. Raintree Court, Unit B, Milwaukee, WI 53223 United States  (Effective: 09-20-2022)
Prior: 8571 South Ventanna Drive #4316, Oak Creek, WI 53154
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
